abstract: Editorial asserts Pres Obama's tax proposals, such as letting the Bush-era tax cuts for high-income taxpayers expire and taxing the earnings of investment managers as regular income rather than capital gains, do not constitute class warfare; argues they are fair measures that are sensible when revenues need to be higher; urges Congress to pass all of them.
snippet: Increasing taxes on the rich is a fair and sound policy. It can help the government pay for programs to revive the economy and wrestle down the deficit.
lead_paragraph: Increasing taxes on the rich is a fair and sound policy. It can help the government pay for programs to revive the economy and wrestle down the deficit.

headline.main: We Thought They Wanted to Be Like Buffett
headline.print_headline: We Thought They Wanted to Be Like Buffett
headline.seo: We Thought They Wanted to Be Like Buffett
